page.title: 14Camping and Caravan Site
page.content: Near Thirsk town centre, occupying part of Thirsk Racecourse, is an attractive caravan and camping site. The site is open on all days when the racecourse is not in use. It is an ideal centre for exploring the North York Moors National Park to the east, the Yorkshire Dales National Park to the west and the many historical sites of the area. It is also a popular overnight stop on the journey to Scotland,being on the A l9 and close to the A l.Dutch, Swedish, Danish, American and tourists from many other countries make this site quite international. Facilities include water points, gas supplies, a vegetable preparation and washing up room and use of the modern stable-lads hostel. This latter has washrooms, showers and a recreation room which includes television.
